page.title: 03LANDSCAPE OF MORFA BYCHAN
page.content: Before the Porthmadog embankment was built,the area was a promontory and the only road to Porthmadog and Borth y Gest ran across the southern slopes of Moel y Gest. A ridge of rock to the west ends on the beach called Black Rock;it has small caves and dramatic formations. The most fertile land is to the west and east,nearly all used for grazing and divided into small fields by dry stone walls and a few hedges.There are not many trees in the area,which is fairly wind-swept,apart from scrub and conifers planted as windbreaks and for screening caravan sites.
